answer_found_by_llm: The IP address 87.96.21.84 is responsible for port scanning activity, as it sent multiple SYN packets to various destination ports, indicating port scanning in the network traffic.

The attacker downloaded several files, including scripts and an executable, from the following URLs: http://87.96.21.84/Invoke-PowerDump.ps1, http://87.96.21.84/del.ps1, http://87.96.21.84/javaw.exe, http://87.96.21.84/ichigo-lite.ps1, http://87.96.21.84/extracted_hosts.txt, http://87.96.21.84/Invoke-SMBExec.ps1, and http://87.96.21.84/checking.ps1.
The second file downloaded by the attacker is likely 'http://87.96.21.84/del.ps1', based on the frequency of HTTP GET requests observed in the network traffic.
The file 'extracted_hosts.txt' likely contains a list of discovered hosts on the network. It is located at the URL 'http://87.96.21.84/extracted_hosts.txt'.
